1.content: But the souls of the just are in the hand of God, and the torment of death shall not touch them.

2.content: In the sight of the unwise they seemed to die: and their departure was taken for misery:

3.content: And their going away from us, for utter destruction: but they are in peace.

4.content: And though in the sight of men they suffered torments, their hope is full of immortality.

5.content: Afflicted in few things, in many they shall be well rewarded: because God hath tried them, and found them worthy of himself.

6.content: As gold in the furnace, he hath proved them, and as a victim of a holocaust, he hath received them, and in time there shall be respect had to them.

7.content: The just shall shine, and shall run to and fro like sparks among the reeds.

8.content: They shall judge nations, and rule over people, and their Lord shall reign for ever.

9.content: They that trust in him shall understand the truth: and they that are faithful in love, shall rest in him: for grace and peace are to his elect.

10.content: But the wicked shall be punished according to their own devices: who have neglected the just, and have revolted from the Lord.

11.content: For he that rejecteth wisdom, and discipline, is unhappy: and their hope is vain, and their labours without fruit, and their works unprofitable.

12.content: Their wives are foolish, and their children wicked.

13.content: Their offspring is cursed, for happy is the barren: and the undefiled, that hath not known bed in sin, she shall have fruit in the visitation of holy souls.

14.content: And the eunuch, that hath not wrought iniquity with his hands, nor thought wicked things against God for the precious gift of faith shall be given to him, and a most acceptable lot in the temple of God.

15.content: For the fruit of good labours is glorious, and the root of wisdom never faileth.

16.content: But the children of adulterers shall not come to perfection, and the seed of the unlawful bed shall be rooted out.

17.content: And if they live long, they shall be nothing regarded, and their last old age shall be without honour.

18.content: And if they die quickly, they shall have no hope, nor speech of comfort in the day of trial.

19.content: For dreadful are the ends of a wicked race.

disclaimer: This book is an addition to the Old Testament. It is not found in the Hebrew or Aramaic texts, but are found in the Greek Septuagint and the Latin Vulgate.
